snippet: Uganda said Tuesday that it was investigating the theft of almost 3,000 pounds of ivory from the vaults of its state-run wildlife protection agency and had suspended five staff members.
abstract: Uganda is investigating theft of almost 3,000 pounds of ivory from the vaults of its state-run Uganda Wildlife Authority; five staff members are suspended.
lead_paragraph: Uganda said Tuesday that it was investigating the theft of almost 3,000 pounds of ivory from the vaults of its state-run wildlife protection agency and had suspended five staff members.

headline.main: Uganda: Inquiry Into Ivory Theft Opens
headline.print_headline: Uganda: Inquiry Into Ivory Theft Opens
